ETYMOLOGY: From Middle English unwis, equivalent to un- (not) + wise (having wisdom).

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: Lacking good sense, judgment, or discretion; foolish or imprudent.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 缺乏判断力、常识或审慎的；不明智的；愚蠢的。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: It was an unwise decision to travel during the height of the storm.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 在风暴最猛烈的时候旅行是一个不明智的决定。
